Package controller

Class ModifyCustomer

java.lang.Object
controller.ModifyCustomer
All Implemented Interfaces:
InitializableWithData, javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyCustomer extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, InitializableWithData
Controller for the Modify Customer GUI of the application. This class is responsible for handling all user interactions on the Modify Customer GUI, including populating the distinct combo boxes, and validating all inputs.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller by setting up the country and division combo boxes. It also sets up a listener on the country combo box to update the division combo box based on the selected country. This method ensures that the UI is correctly populated and responsive to user input, facilitating the modification of customer data.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, providing localized strings for UI components.

    • onCountryCombo

      public void onCountryCombo(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the click event of the combo box for countries, and it populates the correspondent divisions(cities/provinces) per country.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered when the country combo box is clicked.

    • onCancelButton

      public void onCancelButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the click event of the cancel button, it cancels the action of editing a Customer, and it navigates back to the customer list.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered when the cancel button is pressed.

    • onSaveButton

      public void onSaveButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the save action triggered by clicking the 'Save' button on the customer modification form. This method validates the selected division and country for consistency, then saves the updated customer data to the database if all fields are properly filled and validation checks pass. It also handles navigation back to the customer overview screen upon successful data submission.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event that triggered this action, typically the clicking of the 'Save' button.

    • initializeData

      public void initializeData(Object data)
      Initializes the form fields with existing customer data when an instance of Customer is passed. This method is responsible for populating the fields with data from the customer object, ensuring the form is ready for editing.
      Specified by:
      initializeData in interface InitializableWithData
      Parameters:
      data - The customer data to be loaded into the form fields. This should be an instance of Customer.
